criteria: Understanding of Macronutrients (Carbohydrates, Proteins, Fats) and their roles in the body.
Understanding of Micronutrients (Vitamins and Minerals) and their importance.
Ability to relate dietary choices to specific health benefits, referencing research-based guidelines.
Ability to describe a balanced diet that meets the body's needs.
descriptions: Demonstrates no understanding of macronutrients or their functions.
Identifies some macronutrients but shows limited understanding of their roles.
Identifies most macronutrients and their basic roles in providing energy or building tissues.
Explains the roles of macronutrients with some accuracy, including energy provision and tissue building.
Clearly explains the roles of macronutrients in detail, including energy provision, tissue building, and hormonal regulation.
Provides a comprehensive explanation of macronutrient roles, including energy provision, tissue building, hormonal regulation, and the impact of imbalances.
Demonstrates no understanding of micronutrients or their importance.
Identifies a few micronutrients but does not understand their specific functions.
Identifies some micronutrients and their general importance for health.
Explains the importance of micronutrients for health, mentioning specific vitamins and minerals.
Clearly explains the roles of various micronutrients and the health consequences of deficiencies.
Provides a detailed explanation of micronutrient functions, deficiency consequences, and sources of these nutrients.
Unable to relate dietary choices to health benefits or reference dietary guidelines.
Makes vague connections between diet and health without referencing guidelines.
Relates some dietary choices to general health benefits, mentioning dietary guidelines.
Connects specific dietary choices to specific health benefits, referencing dietary guidelines.
Clearly explains how specific dietary choices support specific health benefits, using research-based dietary guidelines.
Provides a comprehensive analysis of how dietary choices impact health, thoroughly integrating research-based dietary guidelines and recent findings.
Unable to describe any elements of a balanced diet.
Lists only a few food groups without mentioning proportions or balance.
Describes some food groups that should be part of a diet but lacks detail.
Describes a balanced diet that includes all major food groups, with some consideration for proportions.
Explains a balanced diet that provides necessary nutrients in appropriate proportions.
Details a highly individualized balanced diet based on specific needs/circumstances and scientific principles.
